definition.en: A circular opening through which water can be discharged from a fire hydrant.
The nominal rate at which water flows through the fire hydrant.

usage.en: Typically measured in liters per minute (L/min).

definition.en: The current operational state of a fire hydrant.
The classification or category of a fire hydrant.
The amount of force with which water moves to a pipe.
The date of the most recently performed inspection of a fire hydrant.
A tool used to open a fire hydrant by removing the cover of a fire hydrant's outlet.
The measurement of the circular opening through which water can be discharged from a fire hydrant.
The nominal diameter of the underground water pipe going along the street.
The current operational state of a pipe.
The classification or category of a pipe.
The date on which the current version of the area or object starts to be used.
A comment about minor flaws affecting the fire hydrant.
The measurement of the circular opening through which the water flow, pressure or volume can be controlled in a fire hydrant.
The classification or category of water.
Information (e.g. e-mail address, telephone number) of a person or department through which the user can get in touch with.
A representation of a unit.
Proper noun applied to a real world entity.

usage.en: This can be substituted by LangString

definition.en: The type of fire hydrant.
The type of pipe.
Entity status.
The type of a metal instrument by which the bolt of a lock is turned.
The nativeness of a geographical name.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used: http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/NativenessValue

definition.en: The status of a geographical name, that is the information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.

usage.en: NOTE The precise definition of the values 'Official', 'Standardised', 'Historical' and 'Other' can only be decided by Member States according to their legislation and practice.

definition.en: A structured reference that identifies an entity.

usage.en: The Identifier class is based on the UN/CEFACT class of the same name and is defined under the ADMS namespace.

definition.en: More readable representation with only the basic data of the address, intended to use an address as an attribute of another object.
The legally recognised name of the organization
A fire hydrant is a fitting in a street or other public place with a nozzle by which a fire hose may be attached to a water main.
A pipe is a passage of water flowing in a closed conduit (i.e., not subject to atmospheric pressure).
A valve is a device designed to control water flow, pressure or volume.
The Geometry class provides the means to identify a Location as a point, line, polygon, etc. expressed using coordinates in some coordinate reference system.
The fire hydrant to which the outlet is physically attached.
The fire hydrant to which the valve is part of.
The main contact information of the resource.
An electronic address through which the Contact Point can be contacted.
A telephone number through which the Contact Point can be contacted.
Link to the agent who issued the identifier
Time when the identifier was issued.
Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, berths, pitches or parcels.
Municipal name of the address.
Qualitative information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.

usage.en: NOTE The Geographical Names application schema does not explicitly make a preference between different names (e.g. official endonyms) of a specific real world entity. The necessary information for making the preference (e.g. the linguistic status of the administrative or geographic area in question), for a certain use case, must be obtained from other data or information sources. For example, the status of the language of the name may be known through queries on the geometries of named places against the geometry of administrative units recorded in a certain source with the language statuses information. Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Name Status code list.

definition.en: Information enabling to acknowledge if the name is the one that is/was used in the area where the spatial object is situated at the instant when the name is/was in use.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Nativeness code list.

definition.en: Original data source from which the geographical name is taken from and integrated in the data set providing/publishing it. For some named spatial objects it might refer again to the publishing data set if no other information is available.
A proper way of writing the geographical name.
Identifier of the object broken down into its parts.
Standard units of measurements used when accounting for stock, and expressing them in quantities.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the EU Vocabulary Measurement unit.

definition.en: A pipe can be attached to other pipes.
The organization in charge of controlling and maintaining the pipe.
The organization in charge of controlling and maintaining the fire hydrant.
The pipe providing water to the fire hydrant.

The fire hydrant receiving water from the pipe
.
The address representation that corresponds to the fire hydrant.
The address representation that corresponds to the pipe.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: Type of the string refers to the identifier (incl its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

definition.en: The legally recognised name of the organization.
Any identifier issued by any authority, whether a government agency or not.

Any identifier issued by any authority, whether a government agency or not. It captures the identifier itself, the type of identifier, and details of the issuing authority, the date on which the identifier was issued.

usage.en: It captures the identifier itself, the type of identifier, and details of the issuing authority, the date on which the identifier was issued.

definition.en: Name of the agent who assigned the identifier.
The fire hydrant's location as a point, expressed using coordinates in some coordinate reference system.
The pipe's location as a point, expressed using coordinates in some coordinate reference system.
Code designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Streetname of the address.
The distinction between whether an organisation is a private or public entity.
Number with a scale. The value of uom (Units Of Measure) attribute is a reference to a Reference System for the amount, either a ratio or position scale.
A list of geographic coordinates that define the extent of the Geometry.

usage.en: Can be expressed as longitude, latitude, elevation.

definition.en: An identifier for the coordinate reference system.

usage.en: Can be a coordinate-based local, regional or global system used to locate geographical entities.

definition.en: The classification of the Geometry.

usage.en: Can be a point, line or polygon.

definition.en: The geometry written in Geography Markup Language.

usage.en: Use "http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#gmlLiteral" as type for the literal.

definition.en: The latitude.
The longitude.
The well-known text representation string describing the point, line or polygon.

usage.en: Use "http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#wktLiteral" as type for the literal.
